page.title: 16LEGEND - OLD KILPATRICK
page.content:
It is thought that{OLD KILPATRICK takes its name from the{legend}that {St Patrick,}the{patron}saint of {Ireland,}was born in the area, later captured by the Romans and{transported to Ireland as a{slave.
Many Irishmen would of course{dispute this story, but the area is steeped in {Roman history;}full of{archaeological remains,(it is the site of the western end of Antonine's Wall,and has the remains of a Roman Fort,) that there may be some{truth}to the tale.
A local{Well,}known as ST Patrick's Well adds to the legend. The large{Catholic}population of the village are{proud}of the connection with the Saint and have{honoured}him by{naming}their new{church}after him.
